title_sort: walt whitman to thomas o'kane, 22 april 1874
title: Walt Whitman to Thomas O'Kane, 22 April 1874
text: April 22, '74I am anxious to have our acc'taccount settled up. Comparing your rec'treceipt of my books from Doolady, April 28, '73 (239 Leaves of Grass, &c. &c)—with the acc'taccount of books handed over by you to Butts (168 Leaves of Grass, &c &c)—see my last letter to you, Feb. 16—there are to be acc'taccount'd for to me, 71 copies, L of G. Deduct 25 copies sent to Boston by my order, & 3 copies to Graphic, leaves 43 copies (@ $1.40) to be acc'taccount'd for to me at $60.20. Deduct from this the adv. 2 times in Tribune and Graphic (4 times)—(?7, or 8 or 9$) leaving over $50 due me—May I not hope for the settlem'tsettlement of this acc'taccount without delay—& remittance to me of am'tamount due.W WI still remain here partially paralyzed. I have not charged the copies of other books besides L. of G. as the sales were slight. Walt Whitman to Thomas O'Kane, 22 April 1874
